content.body: HTML says "This specification does not specify which image types are to be supported."
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: HTML says "This specification does not specify which image types are to be supported."

content.body: Hi folks, coming here from https://github.com/whatwg/dom/issues/586 per @annevk's suggestion
The proposed API looks to me like a "better horse" situation, hence my comments...

Pierre-Yves Gérardy: hey welcome, thanks for joining! And thanks for giving feedback, but note that for effective participation it's usually better to support an existing comment that says as much or leave a single comment that clearly makes your point. Adding a lot of comments to an issue will make them look noisy and more easily ignorable.
content.formatted_body: Pierre-Yves Gérardy: hey welcome, thanks for joining! And thanks for giving feedback, but note that for effective participation it's usually better to support an existing comment that says as much or leave a single comment that clearly makes your point. Adding a lot of comments to an issue will make them look noisy and more easily ignorable.

content.body: And to be clear, the API as proposed wouldn't make it in. If we actually want CSS parity it would need move semantics as discussed in the issue I linked.
